ul.li: 1 cup heavy cream (to be found in fridge in kitchen)

3 cups whole milk, divide (to be found in fridge in kitchen)
1 cup granulated sugar (to be found in cabinet above fridge in kitchen)
2 tablespoons cornstarch (to be found in cabinet above fridge in kitchen)

Pinch of salt
Â½ teaspoon pure vanilla extract (to be found in cabinet above fridge in kitchen)

1 tablespoon liquid pectin (might not be on hand at all times)
Making Instructions
Using a medium saucepan found underneath the stove area in the kitchen, combine the necessary cream and 2 cups of whole milk. Set over a medium-low heat until the mixture simmers.
While waiting on your mixture to simmer, combine the milk, sugar, cornstarch, salt and vanilla extract into a bowl and whisk together until fine.
Once our mixture begins to simmer, add the contents of the bowl and mix together until smooth and combined.
Continue stirring until mixture begins to thicken, taking note of the amount sticking to the spoon.
Remove the pan from the heat, and stir in our pectin. Strain the mixture using the strainer in the cabinet above the fridge and cool to room temperature.
Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Remove from fridge and whisk until smooth again, and add to the top of the yogurt machine after pressing Gelato and selecting the Start button.
